title: [K-12] Design of Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) Educational Strategies for Rural Specialists

context.prior_knowledge: Basic AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) concept understanding with special education or related field experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) support capabilities for rural and remote area professionals

learning_goals: Learners can systematically diagnose the needs of target audiences using a learner-specific AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) knowledge/skill requirements analysis tool.
Learners can propose three or more strategies for effectively utilizing digital/offline AAC resources in resource-constrained environments.
Learners can design context-specific customized AAC education programs by integrating instructional design principles (e.g., ADDIE model) and coaching techniques.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
